name: mcp-publisher
description: Publisher CLI tool for the Official Model Context Protocol (MCP) Registry

repo.name: registry
repo.description: A community driven registry service for Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers.

readme.summary: Well-organized developer-focused documentation that clearly explains the registry concept but lacks end-user installation instructions and practical usage examples.
readme.top_issue: No clear installation instructions for end users wanting to use mcp-publisher as a Homebrew package - all instructions assume you're a developer building from source

injection_risks.description: The PostgreSQL connection URL is stored in the cfg variable, which could potentially be user-controlled. This might lead to a SQL injection vulnerability if not properly sanitized.
The seed source path is stored in the cfg.SeedFrom variable, which could potentially be user-controlled. This might lead to a path traversal vulnerability if not properly sanitized.

critical_findings: Potential SQL injection vulnerability in PostgreSQL connection URL
Potential path traversal vulnerability in seed source path
security.summary: The code has some potential security vulnerabilities, including SQL injection and path traversal risks, but overall it appears to be well-structured and follows good practices.

common_complaints: Documentation/schema URLs pointing to non-existent locations
Publishing workflow blocked by schema validation errors
CLI help functionality not working as documented
sentiment.summary: Moderately healthy project with engaged maintainers addressing bugs and feature requests, though some friction around schema management and documentation accuracy needs resolution.

communication.summary: Maintainer responses are clear, helpful, and patient. They provide technical depth while maintaining a welcoming tone.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being very recent (2026-01-13)
107 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no active maintenance
No merged PRs in past 6 months showing lack of development activity
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests outdated or unmaintained release cycle
maintenance.summary: This package appears abandoned with numerous unaddressed issues and zero development activity over the past 6 months despite a recent repository timestamp.

project_metrics.description: A community driven registry service for Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally well-structured and informative, but lacks troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Community: bug in API handling NUL bytes
Community: deprecated schema errors during publishing
Security: Potential SQL injection vulnerability in PostgreSQL connection URL
Security: Potential path traversal vulnerability in seed source path
highlights: High number of commits in the past six months (363)
A significant number of merged PRs in the past six months (252)
Multiple contributors active in the past six months (45)
